fields.physical_description: 52-page catalogue of Doulton & Co's under-glaze pictorial tile panels made for three London children's hospitals/ wards at the turn of the century.  The catalogue is bound in fawn-coloured boards: the front cover carries the short title 'PICTURES IN POTTERY'  and the firm's name 'ROYAL DOULTON POTTERIES', each with decorative trefoil motifs.  The text is printed in black on cream matt paper and the photogravure illustrations on white glossy paper; the coloured frontispiece, illustrating a different version of 'Here we go gathering nuts in May' to that on p.40, is tipped in.  The first nineteen panels illustrate mainly nursery rhymes and were made for University College Hospital; the next six, for St Thomas' Hospital, show pairs of scenes from fairy tales; the next four show nursery rhymes; and the last two, made for the Children's Hospital at Paddington Green, illustrate the Nativity, and Christ as the Good Shepherd.
fields.dimensions: Height: 18.9 cm, Width: 12.7 cm closed, Depth: 1 cm
fields.title: "PICTURES IN POTTERY." A NOTE ON SOME HOSPITAL WALL DECORATIONS RECENTLY EXECUTED BY DOULTON & CO., LIMITED, LAMBETH, LONDON, S.E.
fields.materials_techniques: Printed paper illustrated with photogravure, bound in boards
fields.marks:
"PICTURES IN POTTERY." A NOTE ON SOME HOSPITAL WALL DECORATIONS RECENTLY EXECUTED BY DOULTON & CO., LIMITED, LAMBETH, LONDON, S.E.
PRINTED AT THE DE MONTFORT PRESS, LEICESTER, BY RAITHBY, LAWRENCE & CO., LIMITED, IN THE MONTH OF AUGUST, ANNO DOMINI ONE THOUSAND NINE HUNDRED AND FOUR.
fields.history_note:
References: See tile panel C.112-1977, made to the design 'Mary, Mary, quite contrary' (illustrated on p 19)
Subjects: 'Lady Queen Anne', 'Simple Simon', 'Sleeping Beauty', 'Mary, Mary, quite contrary', 'Jack & Jill', 'Little Boy Blue', 'Little Miss Muffet', 'Cinderella', 'Old King Cole', 'There was an old woman who lived in a shoe', 'Little Red Riding Hood', 'Little Bo-Peep', 'The Queen of Hearts', 'Higgledy, piggledy, my black hen', 'See-saw, Margery Daw', 'Puss in Boots', 'The Goose Girl', 'Hansel & Gretel', 'Here we go gathering nuts in May', 'Ding Dong Bell', 'Little Jack Horner', 'Old Mother Hubbard', 'The Holy Babe in the Manger', 'The Good Shepherd'.

Price: £20
fields.production_note:
Made by: 1. Royal Doulton Potteries/ Doulton & Co
2. Raithby, Lawrence & Co (printers)
3. 'Mary, Mary, quite contrary' design on p.19 by Margaret E Thompson
